item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Middle-aged man trading cards go viral in rural Japan town (742 points | 144 comments)
2. Any program can be a GitHub Actions shell (85 points | 8 comments)
3. Listening habits&subjective effects of background music in young adults ± ADHD (32 points | 8 comments)
4. Show HN: Browser MCP – Automate your browser using Cursor, Claude, VS Code (391 points | 149 comments)
5. Show HN: Lux – A luxurious package manager for Lua (191 points | 65 comments)
6. Deleting multiplayer from the Unreal engine can save memory (37 points | 11 comments)
7. What Was Quartz? (74 points | 29 comments)
8. 'Exploding' Tunnock's teacakes cleared by tests to fly again (17 points | 2 comments)
9. A Supermarket Bag and a Truckload of FOMO (46 points | 8 comments)
10. Fifty Years of Open Source Software Supply Chain Security (124 points | 58 comments)
11. Beyond Quacking: Deep Integration of Language Models and RAG into DuckDB (60 points | 10 comments)
12. Scaffold Level Editor (81 points | 19 comments)
13. An FPGA-based LGP-30 Replica (15 points | 1 comment)
14. India's repair culture gives new life to dead laptops (25 points | 5 comments)
15. Hasochism: The pleasure and pain of dependently typed Haskell programming [pdf] (2013) (77 points | 11 comments)
16. North Korean IT workers have infiltrated the Fortune 500 (91 points | 42 comments)
17. Ancient Dagger Up to 2.5k Years Old W Stars/Moons/Geometric Patterns Unearthed (38 points | 6 comments)

19. Decoding the 90s: Cryptography in Early Software Development (2023) (107 points | 32 comments)
20. Unmasking EncryptHub: Help from ChatGPT and Opsec Blunders (8 points | discuss)
21. PiDP-1, or the rebirth of an old machine (80 points | 29 comments)
22. 20 years of Git (234 points | 167 comments)
23. Why Companies Don't Fix Bugs (41 points | 15 comments)
24. Rsync replaced with openrsync on macOS Sequoia (537 points | 420 comments)
25. Glamorous Toolkit (307 points | 111 comments)
26. The Troll Hole Adventure (34 points | 10 comments)
27. In the 1980s we also downloaded software from TV (35 points | 16 comments)
28. We asked camera companies why their RAW formats are all different and confusing (346 points | 202 comments)
29. Benchmarking LLM social skills with an elimination game (171 points | 51 comments)
30. A startup doesn't need to be a unicorn (538 points | 324 comments)
